intro: Tephrosia ambigua var. intermedia, commonly known as the Mexican tephrosia, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, with trifoliate leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in hairy pods and are often used in traditional medicine due to their pesticidal properties. The plant's botanical features make it an important species in ecological and agricultural contexts.
